questions: Q. 1. What is a pure substance ?
answers: Ans. A substance which is made up of only a single type of particle is called a pure substance.

questions: Q. 2. What are mixtures ?
answers: Ans. Mixtures are constituted by more than one kind of pure form of matter, i.e. pure substances.

questions: Q. 3. What is a substance ?
answers: Ans. A substance is a kind of matter that cannot be separated into other kinds of matter by any physical process.

questions: Q. 4. What are the constituents of milk ?
answers: Ans. Milk is a mixture of water, fat and proteins.

questions: Q. 5. Which of the following is/are pure substance ? Ink, paper, water, milk, butter, ghee, sugar, blood.
answers: Ans. Water and sugar.

questions: Q. 6. Name the two types of mixtures.
answers: Ans. Homogeneous mixtures and heterogeneous mixtures.

questions: Q. 7. What is a homogeneous mixture ?
answers: Ans. A mixture that has uniform composition throughout its mass is called a homogeneous mixture.

questions: Q. 8. What is a heterogeneous mixture ?
answers: Ans. A mixture that does not have uniform composition throughout its mass is called a heterogeneous mixture.

questions: Q. 9. Define a solution.
answers: Ans. A homogeneous mixture of two or more substances is called a solution. 1 Mark each

questions: Q. 10. Give an example of a liquid in liquid type solution.
answers: Ans. Vinegar .

questions: Q. 11. Give an example of a solid in liquid solution.
answers: Ans. A solution of sugar and water.

questions: Q. 12. Give an example of a solid solution.
answers: Ans. Brass . 1

questions: Q. 13. Give an example of a gas in liquid solution.
answers: Ans. Aerated drinks like soda water.

questions: Q. 14. Define concentration of a solution.
answers: Ans. It indicates the exact amount of solute dissolved in an exact amount of solvent or solution.

questions: Q. 15. What is solubility ?
answers: Ans. Solubility of a substance  is the mass of the substance in grams that dissolves in 100 g of a solvent to form a saturated solution.

questions: Q. 16. What is a saturated solution ?
answers: Ans. A solution is said to be saturated if no more of solute can be dissolved in it at a given temperature and pressure.

questions: Q. 17. What is a suspension ?
answers: Ans. It is a heterogeneous mixture in which the solute particles do not dissolve and remain suspended throughout the liquid.

questions: Q. 18. What is a colloidal solution ?
answers: Ans. It is a heterogeneous mixture in which the size of the solute particles is between 1 nm  to 100 nm. IS MATTER AROUND US PURE ?

questions: Q. 19. Why can’t we see the colloidal particles with naked eyes ?
answers: Ans. Because their size ranges from 1 nm to 100 nm, hence we can’t see such small particles with naked eyes.

questions: Q. 20. What is a gel ?
answers: Ans. It is a colloidal solution of a liquid in solid. e.g. butter, cheese etc.

questions: Q. 21. What is an emulsion ?
answers: Ans. A colloidal solution of two immiscible liquids is called an emulsion. e.g. milk.

questions: Q. 22. Name the three types of elements.
answers: Ans. Metals, non-metals and metalloids.

questions: Q. 23. Which metal is liquid at room temperature ?
answers: Ans. Mercury.

questions: Q. 24. Name the substance that is composed of atoms of different elements in a fixed proportion.
answers: Ans. Compound.
